alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Pope (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 7:35PM CST until January 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Paducah KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky...Illinois... Ohio River at Golconda affecting Crittenden, Livingston, Hardin and Pope Counties. Ohio River at Paducah affecting McCracken, Livingston, Pope and Massac Counties. For the Ohio River...including Owensboro, Newburgh Dam, Evansville, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown, Golconda, Smithland Dam, Paducah, Olmsted Lock and Dam, Cairo...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Golconda. * WHEN...From late Sunday night to Tuesday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Saturday the stage was 39.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will begin rising just after midnight tonight and rise above flood stage early Monday morning to 40.3 feet early Tuesday morning. It will fall below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
